util

Class MinMax

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.MinMax
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MinMax
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is a utility class used to simplify the process of keeping track and getting the minimum and maximum values of a set of numerical data. This was created in the context of Layers, which iteratively go through thousands of data points and calculate various values for them/
    Author:
    Calvin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinMax

        public MinMax()

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double d)
        Every time a new value of the data set is calculated, the MinMax needs to be updated with that value. This method will check to see if the new value is less than the minimum or higher than the maximum and, if so, updates the minimum and maximum values of the data set.
        Parameters:
        d - the new value of the data set

      • getRange

        public double getRange()
        Returns:
        the range of the data set

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints itself for debugging puposes. It follows the format "min: " + min + " max: " + max
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
